variable.name: shareid
variable.description: Framingham Heart Study participant SHARe ID number

variable.name: DIAG_TYP
variable.description: Method of diagnosis - represents the basis of diagnosis

variable.name: EXACT
variable.description: Type of Date - diagnosis date qualifier - indicates the quality of D_DATE
variable.value: Month, date and year of diagnosis date taken from pathology report or other test report.
Estimated diagnosis date as described in variable D_DATE

variable.name: TOPO
variable.description: Topography - describes site - corresponds to first three digits of topography code WHO ICD-O
variable.value: Other and unspecified parts of mouth
Pharynx and ill-defined sites in lip, oral cavity and pharynx
Rectum, rectosigmoid junction, anal canal and anus, not otherwise specified
Other and ill-defined sites within digestive organs and peritoneum
Nasal cavities, accessory sinuses, middle ear and inner ear
Other and ill-defined sites within respiratory system and intrathoracic organs
Connective, subcutaneous and other soft tissues
Skin (excludes skin of labia majora, skin of vulva, skin of penis and skin of scrotum)
Ovary, fallopian tube and broad ligament
Other and unspecified female genital organs
Penis and other male genital organs
Other and unspecified parts of the nervous system (excludes peripheral nerves, sympathetic and parasympathetic nerves and ganglia)

variable.name: LOCATION
variable.description: Location - describes subdivision of site - corresponds to fourth digit of topography code WHO ICD-O

variable.name: HIST
variable.description: Histology or morphology - describes cell histopathology - corresponds to four digit morphology code WHO ICD-O
variable.comment: Additional morphology codes from the ICD-O-3 code book are added to the FHS cancer coding system: 8046 - Non-small cell carcinoma; 8077 - Squamous intraepithelial neoplasia, Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia, Vaginal intraepithelial neoplasia, Vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia, Anal intraepithelial neoplasia; 8130 - Papillary transitional cell carcinoma; 8148 - Glandular intraepithelial neoplasia, Prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia; 8162 - Klatskin tumor; 8317 - Renal cell carcinoma, chromophobe type; 9590-9769 - Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin lymphomas; 9590-9596 - Malignant lymphomas, NOS or diffuse; 9650-9667 - Hodgkin's lymphoma; 9670-9729 - Non-Hodgkin's lymphomas; 9670-9699 - Mature B-cell lymphomas; 9673 - Mantle cell lymphoma; 9680 - Malignant lymphoma, large B-cell, diffuse or malignant lymphoma, large cell; 9700-9719 - Mature T-cell and NK-cell lymphomas; 9727-9729 - Precursor cell lymohoblastic lymphomas; 9731-9734 - Plasma cell tumors; 9740-9742 - Mast cell tumors; 9750-9758 - Neoplasms of histiocytes and accessory lymphoid cells; 9760-9769 - Immunoproliferative diseases; 9872 - Acute myeloid leukemia, minimal differentiation; 9989 - Myelodysplastic syndrome, NOS

variable.name: BEHAVIOR
variable.description: Behavior - decribes the degree of malignancy - corresponds to the fifth digit behavior code WHO ICD-O
variable.comment: This set contains only cases where BEHAVIOR = 2 or BEHAVIOR = 3. Metastatic code (BEHAVIOR = 6) was not used; rather the location of the primary site was used. If the primary site is unknown, the code 199 is used for the site.
variable.value: Malignant, uncertain whether primary or metastatic site

variable.name: GRADE
variable.description: Grade - correspnds to code for histologic grading and differentiation WHO ICD-O
variable.value: Grade II - moderately well-differentiated, moderately differentiated
Grade or differentiation not determined, stated, or applicable

variable.name: ESTRGN
variable.comment: This variable was added to the data collection form in version 10-01-07.
variable.value: Unknown or collected on a form that did not contain this variable

variable.name: PRGSTRN
variable.comment: This variable was added to the data collection form in version 10-01-07.
variable.value: Unknown or collected on a form that did not contain this variable

variable.name: H2NI
variable.description: HER2NEU (human epidermal growth factor receptor 2) by IHC (immunohistochemistry)
variable.comment: This variable was added to the data collection form in version 10-01-07.
variable.value: Unknown or collected on a form that did not contain this variable

variable.name: H2NF
variable.description: HER2NEU (human epidermal growth factor receptor 2) by FISH (fluorescence in situ hybridization)
variable.comment: This variable was added to the data collection form in version 10-01-07.
variable.value: Unknown or collected on a form that did not contain this variable

variable.name: TISSUE_1
variable.description: Tissue #1 related to Gleason score for prostate cancer
variable.comment: Classifying prostate cancer cells in terms of how abnormal they appear when examined under a microscope. Grades range from 1 to 5 with 1 being the lease aggressive and 5 the most aggressive. This variable was added to the data collection form in version 10-01-07.
variable.value: Unknown or collected on a form that did not contain this variable

variable.name: TISSUE_2
variable.description: Tissue #2 related to Gleason score for prostate cancer
variable.comment: Classifying prostate cancer cells in terms of how abnormal they appear when examined under a microscope. Grades range from 1 to 5 with 1 being the lease aggressive and 5 the most aggressive. This variable was added to the data collection form in version 10-01-07.
variable.value: Unknown or collected on a form that did not contain this variable

variable.name: GLEASON
variable.description: Gleason score: classifying prostate cancer cells
variable.comment: Gleason score (total between 2-10) TISSUE_1 + TISSUE_2 = GLEASON. If only GLEASON is given, TISSUE_1 and TISSUE_2 = "." If no scores are given, GLEASON = "." and TISSUE_1 and TISSUE_2 = "." This variable was added to the data collection form in version 10-01-07.
variable.value: Unknown or collected on a form that did not contain this variable

variable.name: indicator
variable.description: Indicates ICD-O code book used for coding
variable.value: ICD-O-3 code book using 'Coding Guidelines for Topography and Morphology' in front of code book

variable.name: d_date
variable.description: Diagnosis date of tumor or cancer
variable.comment: Date was taken from pathology reports if available. Date was taken from other records if pathology report was not available or if diagnosis was made before the biopsy then the variable EXACT = 1. If month and year were available, but not day, the 15th was used as the day, and the variable EXACT = 1. If only the year was available, JULY 4 was used as the month and day, and the variable EXACT = 1. In some cases if biopsy was done at autopsy, then D_DATE was changed to precede DATE OF DEATH by one day. number of days since exam 1.

variable.name: VERSION
variable.description: Version date of the data collection form
variable.comment: Prior to 10-01-2007 data collection forms did not have version dates
